Download an LTE or GSM Data Model Service Definition File

Use this task to download the LTE (4G) or GSM (2G) data model service definition file to view descriptions in the json file to better understand how to configure 4G and 2G data model parameters and their values, modify default parameters in the LTE or GSM data model service definition files, or create new LTE or GSM data model service definition files from the defaults. A data model describes what parameters are service affecting or can be updated dynamically, such as the units, and so on.

  1. In the navigation bar, click Devices > Service Definition.
  2. In the Service Definition window, click the download icon in the Action column for the LTE or GSM data service model you want and save the .json file to your local system directory. When you open the json file in an editor, such as notepad, this file is unformatted.
    NOTE: We recommend using a tool to validate and format the LTE or GSM data model service definition file so you can easily make changes to the file if desired.
  3. If you want to add a new LTE or GSM data model service definition file, click CREATE+ field.
  4. In the Upload Service Definition dialog box, click SERVICE DEFINITION +.
  5. A dialog box appears to find the LTE or GSM data model service definition json file that you modified or renamed. Click Open to queue the file and click CREATE+. The existed service definition file is updated. If a new service definition was created from the existing LTE or GSM data model service definition, it appears in the Service Definition window.
Parent topic: Create Device Profiles
